Post with notes

See new posts
Quote
Kamala Harris
@KamalaHarris
·
Aug 17
I grew up in a middle-class household. For most of my childhood, we were renters.

My mother saved for well over a decade to buy a home. I was a teenager when the day finally came—and I can still remember how excited she was.

In college, I worked at McDonald’s to earn spending
Show more

Notes suggesting context to be shown with the post

She was from an elite family. 

https://x.com/guang_lie/status/1824836404964106248?s=46&t=4FGT4eH_O--vA56Jx2Ab0Q
Is this note helpful?

VP Harris’ parents were the elite of their society. Here are documents detailing her mother’s information.

https://www.uscis.gov/sites/default/files/document/foia/Shyamala_Gopalan_Harris.pdf
Is this note helpful?

This post is a fabricated lie to appeal to more voters in the U.S. - she and her family were not middle-class by any means.

There is plenty of verifiable and public info online, including government sites, which prove the opposite.

A summary can be found in this user’s tweet -https://x.com/guang_lie/status/1824836404964106248?s=46&t=lVaWCS_LwqQo3cfBTg66rw
Is this note helpful?
Notes explaining why added context isn’t needed

A stipend of $8k a year hardly makes her mother elite 
Is this a helpful explanation of why added context isn’t needed?

NNN - and there's no such thing as the opposite of middle
Is this a helpful explanation of why added context isn’t needed?

Don’t source your community notes with Twitter posts. This shouldn’t have to be said.

If you want to write a note please link to reputable sources that share their evidence/sources too. Attached is an elementary-level, readable guide for sourcing:

https://www.scribbr.com/working-with-sources/credible-sources/
